children.value: Matrix setter functions no longer support ommitted parameters. (Motivation: Increased API rigor, improved debugging and library compactness).

properties.ariaLabel: matrix transforms now return arrays by default permalink

children.value: Matrix transforms now return Arrays by default
classes no longer by default create new
instances. Instead they create standard JavaScript arrays.
The old behavior can be restored by providing the result parameter
Motivation: This change reduces dependencies between math.gl core classes which improves tree-shaking and bundle sizes.

properties.ariaLabel: matrix setter functions no longer support ommitted parameters permalink

children.value: Matrix setter functions no longer support ommitted parameters
Motivation: This change increases rigor, facilitates debugging, and improves library compactness, and the use case for default parameters was questionable.

The following functions have been removed:
Cross products by definition work on 3 dimensional vectors.
